markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dual Thrower](/Feats.aspx?ID=1951) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 170 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Dual-Weapon Warrior](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=57)

**Prerequisites**
[Dual-Weapon Warrior Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1950)

</column>

---

You know how to throw two weapons as easily as strike with them. Whenever a dual-weapon warrior feat allows you to make a melee Strike, you can instead make a ranged Strike with a [thrown](/Traits.aspx?ID=195) weapon or a one-handed ranged weapon you are wielding. Any effects from these feats that apply to one-handed melee weapons or melee Strikes also apply to one-handed ranged weapons and ranged Strikes.
name: Dual Thrower

Any effects from these feats that apply to one-handed melee weapons or melee Strikes also apply to one-handed ranged weapons and ranged Strikes.
